subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tesing-testing
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
This all seems simple to me. If you're going to put up a recording for
others to listen to, others listen to it. They either hear it, they hear
something different, or they hear nothing. And they say so. That doesn't
make less of what you hear. You hear what you hear. You're free to assert
what you hear or change your mind and say it's something else later on.

It seems to me that's all we're doing at this point. I'm not going to get
into a discussion of where the sounds came from or what they mean, I'd just
say yes I heard it or no I didn't ot I heard something else.

Is that so difficult?

Zack

On Thu, Jun 17, 2010 at 9:28 AM, purplespacefriend <
purplealiengirl@gmail.com> wrote:

>
>
> What you don't seem to get is that there is more to the individual than the

>
> Apparently reading what one wants to hear is also problem, and seems to ge

> group of groupies, and she ignores all else.
>
> Guess we are not allowed to question out loud, or throw thoughts and
> theories out there for the consideration and comment of others. Sorry, not
> being from "here" I didn't learn all the social taboos of this primitive
> culture. I tried goose stepping once, it made my ankles hurt.
>
> I took the skeptics off moderation in a mistaken effort to be fair, but all
> this does is disrupt the conversation about what these voices are, and how
> to hear it and interpret it better. This group is not about how to explain
> all the inconvenient truths away.
>
> Frank-S
>
> 
>
